title: Typeface for Paris?
content: A bit vague, but any suggestions for a typeface that could feel Parisian, but not stuffy or too historical? Something a little quirky, but good for body copy?
author: evilfansanfran

comments.content: I'd start with Bodoni and explore the whole didone category.

Do look at all the fonts here:  
 [http://typofonderie.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101102810/http:/typofonderie.com/ "http://typofonderie.com/")  
Most of them are too mainstream in this case, but there's some nice quirky stuff too.

hhp

> I’d start with Bodoni and explore the whole didone category.

I think starting with Bodoni is fine. I would not finish with Bodoni, though. Using a didone face in order to achieve that _air de Paris_ ambiance feels a bit too obvious. What about trying one of those rarely-used Frutiger serif designs?

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101102810im_/http:/ic.pics.livejournal.com/m_zhukov/967599/38558/38558_600.gif)

Bodoni is Italian; it would be a bad choice for Paris.  
In addition both Bodoni and Didot are neolassical fonts used all over Europe starting from the end of 17th Century.

You'll maybe find some nice inspirations in this video  
 [http://vimeo.com/channels/nicetype/18886355](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101102810/http:/vimeo.com/channels/nicetype/18886355 "http://vimeo.com/channels/nicetype/18886355")
